description: This trap indicates an event where user-interaction is required immediately.
Some example events are component failures or critical errors.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SM10-R3-MIB::storageArrayCritical SM10-R3-MIB::deviceHostIPType i 0 SM10-R3-MIB::deviceHostIPAddr s EXAMPLE SM10-R3-MIB::deviceHostName s EXAMPLE SM10-R3-MIB::deviceUserLabel s EXAMPLE SM10-R3-MIB::deviceErrorCode s EXAMPLE SM10-R3-MIB::eventTime s EXAMPLE SM10-R3-MIB::trapDescription s EXAMPLE SM10-R3-MIB::componentType s EXAMPLE SM10-R3-MIB::componentLocation s EXAMPLE

description: Type of IP Address of the network-attached device or device host. 0 unknown, 1 ipv4, 2 ipv6
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::deviceHostIPType

description: IP Address of the network-attached device or device host.
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::deviceHostIPAddr

description: The user label for the host of the device being reported on.
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::deviceHostName

description: The user label for the device being reported on.
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::deviceUserLabel

description: The error code as reported by the device or host.
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::deviceErrorCode

description: The time at which the event happen on the device.
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::eventTime

description: A string to indicate the nature of the trap
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::trapDescription

description: A string to identify the failing component type
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::componentType

description: A string to identify the location of the failing component
variables.name: SM10-R3-MIB::componentLocation
